AccessKey.description: Access key for the cloud provider. This helps to authenticate the user and get access to the provider.

Alert.description: Alert definition. Used to send an alert notification.

acknowledgedTime.description: Timestamp at which the alert was acknowledged

nextNotificationTime.description: Time of the next notification attempt

notificationAttemptTime.description: Time of the last notification attempt

notificationsFailed.description: Count of failures to send a notification

notifiedState.description: Alert state in the last-sent notification

resolvedTime.description: Timestamp at which the alert was resolved

active.description: Is configured alerts raised or not

durationSec.description: Duration in seconds, while condition is met to raise an alert

AlertConfigurationTarget.description: Alert target. Set to `all`, or specify one or more target UUIDs.

active.description: Is configured alerts raised or not

durationSec.description: Duration in seconds, while condition is met to raise an alert

thresholdInteger.description: Is alert threshold integer or floating point

thresholdReadOnly.description: Is alert threshold read-only or configurable

AlertConfigurationThreshold.description: Alert configuration threshold. Conditions can be either greater than a specified value, or less than a specified value.

condition.description: Threshold condition (greater than, or less than)

reportBackupFailures.description: Trigger an alert for backup failures

reportOnlyErrors.description: Trigger an alert only for errors

sendAlertsToYb.description: Send alerts to YB as well as to customer

statusUpdateIntervalMs.description: Status update of alert interval, in milliseconds

Audit.description: Audit logging for requests and responses

active.description: AZ status. This value is `true` for an active AZ.

AvailabilityZoneData.description: Details of an availability zone, used by the API and UI to validate data against input constraints

Backup.description: A single backup. Includes the backup's status, expiration time, and configuration.

customerUUID.description: Customer UUID that owns this backup

expiry.description: Expiry time (unix timestamp) of the backup

scheduleUUID.description: Schedule UUID, if this backup is part of a schedule

cmkArn.description: Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the CMK

cronExpression.description: Cron expression for a recurring backup

firstTry.description: Whether this task has been tried before

ignoreErrors.description: Should table backup errors be ignored

parallelism.description: Number of concurrent commands to run on nodes over SSH

schedulingFrequency.description: Frequency to run the backup, in milliseconds

sourceAsyncReplicationRelationships.description: The source universe's sync replication relationships

targetAsyncReplicationRelationships.description: The target universe's async replication relationships

timeBeforeDelete.description: Time before deleting the backup from storage, in milliseconds

cmkArn.description: Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the CMK

firstTry.description: Whether this task has been tried before

sourceAsyncReplicationRelationships.description: The source universe's sync replication relationships

targetAsyncReplicationRelationships.description: The target universe's async replication relationships

CertificateInfo.description: SSL certificate used by the universe

customerUUID.description: Customer UUID of the backup which it belongs to

inUse.description: Indicates whether the certificate is in use. This value is `true` if the universe contains a reference to the certificate.

universeDetails.description: Associated universe details for the certificate

CloudSpecificInfo.description: Node information reported by the cloud provider

assignPublicIP.description: True if the node has a public IP address assigned

subnet_id.description: ID of the subnet on which this node is deployed

useTimeSync.description: True if `use time sync` is enabled

ColumnDetails.description: Details of a CQL database column

columnOrder.description: Relative position (column order) for this column, in the table and in CQL commands

isClusteringKey.description: True if this column is a clustering key

isPartitionKey.description: True if this column is a partition key

sortOrder.description: Sort order for this column. Valid only for clustering columns.

CustomerAlertData.description: Format of an alert, used by the API and UI to validate data against input constraints

CustomerConfig.description: Customer configuration. Includes storage, alerts, password policy, and call-home level.

inUse.description: True if there is an in use reference to the object

CustomerDetailsData.description: Customer details, including their universe UUIDs. Only the customer code and name are modifiable.

diskIops.description: Desired IOPS for the volumes mounted on this instance

mountPoints.description: Comma-separated list of mount points for the devices in each instance

numVolumes.description: Number of volumes to be mounted on this instance at the default path

storageType.description: Storage type used for this instance

throughput.description: Desired throughput for the volumes mounted on this instance

volumeSize.description: The size of each volume in each instance

encryptionAtRestEnabled.description: Whether a universe is currently encrypted at rest

opType.description: Operation type: enable, disable, or rotate the universe key/encryption at rest

type.description: Whether to generate a data key or just retrieve the CMK ARN

active.description: True if the instance is active

memSizeGB.description: The instance's memory size, in gigabytes

numCores.description: The instance's number of CPU cores

cmkArn.description: Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the CMK

cronExpression.description: Cron expression for a recurring backup

firstTry.description: Whether this task has been tried before

ignoreErrors.description: Should table backup errors be ignored

parallelism.description: Number of concurrent commands to run on nodes over SSH

schedulingFrequency.description: Frequency to run the backup, in milliseconds

sourceAsyncReplicationRelationships.description: The source universe's sync replication relationships

targetAsyncReplicationRelationships.description: The target universe's async replication relationships

timeBeforeDelete.description: Time before deleting the backup from storage, in milliseconds

frequency.description: Frequency of the schedule, in minutes

status.description: Status of the task. Possible values are _Active_, _Paused_, or _Stopped_.

taskType.description: Type of task to be scheduled. This can be either a multi-table backup, or a full-universe backup.

mutableScope.description: Mutability of the scope. Only super admin users can change global scope; other scopes are customer-mutable.

useSSL.description: Connect to SMTP server using SSL

useTLS.description: Connect to SMTP server using TLS

columns.description: Details of all columns in the table

keyspace.description: Keyspace to which this table belongs

ttlInSeconds.description: The default table-level time to live, in seconds. A value of `-1` represents an infinite TTL.
